questions.question: What is the main concept behind time blocking?
options: Completing tasks as they come up
Working only when you feel productive
Dividing your day into scheduled time blocks for specific tasks
Avoiding planning altogether
questions.explanation: Time blocking involves assigning dedicated time slots to specific tasks to improve focus and productivity.

questions.question: What is the first step in implementing time blocking?
options: Estimate how long each task will take
Start working on random tasks
List all your daily tasks
Take breaks first
questions.explanation: Begin by writing down all the tasks you need to accomplish before assigning time to them.

questions.question: How does time blocking support prioritization?
options: By assigning random time slots to low-effort tasks
By allowing you to delay urgent work
By turning goals into scheduled commitments based on importance
By eliminating the need for task lists
questions.explanation: Time blocking reinforces prioritization by ensuring high-impact tasks are scheduled and completed first.

questions.question: Which productivity technique can be combined with time blocking for better results?
options: Pomodoro Technique
Mind mapping
Highlighting
Multitasking
questions.explanation: The Pomodoro Technique can enhance time blocking by structuring focused work and break intervals.

questions.question: Why is it helpful to include buffer time in your time blocks?
options: To waste less time on planning
To take long naps
To reduce flexibility
To manage unexpected interruptions and prevent task overflow
questions.explanation: Buffer time helps absorb delays and keeps your schedule realistic and less stressful.
